# Case Studies

## Stable Switching {auto-animate="true"}

* Given two unstable closed-loop systems

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width=65%}

\begin{align*}
    \dot{x} &= A_1x = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ 2 & 0 \end{bmatrix} x, \\
    \dot{x} &= A_2x = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & -2 \\ 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix} x,
\end{align*}
find stable switching system that converges to $x^*=(0, 0)$

:::{.fragment fragment-index=1}
* Maximum number of state partitions set to 4
:::

:::

:::{.column width=35%}

:::{.fragment fragment-index=0}
![](contents/assets/unstable_switching.png){.absolute top=20 left=700 width="400" height="400"}
:::

:::
::::

:::{.fragment fragment-index=2}
* The gating network $\mathbf{P}(x | \psi)$ is a fully-connected neural net with 4 outputs
* There are 4 experts with parameters $\theta_i$ 
\begin{align*}
    F_i(\theta_i) = \begin{cases}
       0, & \theta_i > \frac{1}{2}, \\
       1, & \theta_i \leq \frac{1}{2},
    \end{cases}
\end{align*}
:::

## Stable Switching {auto-animate="true"}

* The gating network $\mathbf{P}(x | \psi)$ is a fully-connected neural net with 4 outputs
* There are 4 experts with parameters $\theta_i$ 
\begin{align*}
    F_i(\theta_i) = \begin{cases}
       0, & \theta_i > \frac{1}{2}, \\
       1, & \theta_i \leq \frac{1}{2},
    \end{cases}
\end{align*}

:::{.fragment fragment-index=0}
* **Objective**: learn $(\psi, \theta)$ that minimize the accumulated loss
$$
\ell(x, u) = \frac{1}{2}(x - x^*)^\top \mathcal{Q} (x - x^*) + \frac{1}{2} u^\top \mathcal{R} u, \; \; \mathcal{Q} = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & 0 \\ 0 & 3 \end{bmatrix}, \mathcal{R} = 0
$$
:::

:::{.fragment fragment-index=1}
* The corresponding likelihood is
:::

:::{.r-stack}
:::{.fragment .fade-in-then-out fragment-index=2}
$$
\mathbb{L}(\phi) = \sum_{t=0}^{T} \sum_{i=1}^{N_F} - \ell (x(t+\Delta t), F_i ) P_i (x(t) | \psi ) 
$$
:::

:::{.fragment .fade-in fragment-index=3}
\begin{gather*}
    \mathbb{L}(\phi) = \sum_{t=0}^{T} \sum_{i=1}^{N_F} - \mathcal{l} P_i (x(t) | \psi ) \\
        \mathcal{l} = \theta_i \ell (x(t + \Delta t), F_i(\theta_i) ) + (1 - \theta_i)\ell (x(t + \Delta t), F_i(1-\theta_i) ) 
\end{gather*}
:::

:::

## Cartpole with wall barriers

:::{.r-stack}

:::{.fragment .fade-in-then-out fragment-index=0}

::::{.columns}
:::{.column width=50%}
* Cartpole: pendulum hinged on an actuated cart
* **Objective**: swingup the pendulum to the upright using the control authority on the cart
* *Linear Quadratic Regulator (LQR)* IS used to stabilize after swingup
:::

:::{.column width=50%}
{{< video contents/assets/cartpole-firefox.mp4 aspect-ratio="4x3" width="600" >}}
(Sirichotiyakul *ACC 2022*)
:::
::::

:::

:::{.fragment .fade-in-then-out fragment-index=1}
::::{.columns}

:::{.column width=50%}
* The wall barriers create a contact-rich (hybrid) system
* Notice *LQR* fails due to the impact from the wall
* We employ contact-aware MOE controller to 
    + leverage the impacts from the wall
    + switch to a policy that assists in the catching process
:::

:::{.column width=50%}
{{< video contents/assets/cartpole_oneController.mp4 aspect-ratio="4x3" width="600" >}}
:::

::::
:::

:::{.fragment .fade-in fragment-index=2}
{{< video contents/assets/moeController.mp4 width="900" height="650" >}}
:::

## Observations

::::{.columns}

:::{.column width=50%}
* The MOE controller switches just after impact
* After impact, the active expert applies rapid braking

![](contents/assets/moe_traj_control.jpg)
:::

:::{.column width=50%}
* There is a relationship between the minimum gap between the pendulum and the walls, and the expert used
* An expert is dedicated to states with low chance of contact and viceversa

![](contents/assets/gapContourAndBins.jpg)
:::
